title: I don't understand how Riot can be so obsessed with champion classifications
body: But then refuse to help balance the game by creating class specific items, actually making these classes mean something because lets face it, calling champs like Zyra a catcher or Leblanc a kite mage or whatever the fuck isn't going to solve any of their problems, it's just useless fluff but the thing is it doesn't need to be.  Tanks building support items, ADCs building bruiser items, these don't have to be problems.

replies.body: The objective is to have more clarification on how to play when someone gets a new champ. Just support implies that all they do is help. But not how.  This also makes it impossible for champs to find alt builds. Ie Lulu. Lulu is a support. However if unable to build ad items you couldnt injoy the destructive attack speed Lulu.

I may be wrong, but I dont think the point of the op is to make it were lux cant build {{item:3091}}  , but rather if an item is meant for a specific class have them be more like {{item:3077}} {{item:3085}}  or even {{item:3153}} . Those items are split based on melee or ranged, so why couldnt an item like {{item:3107}}  be "Enchanter only" for example. And {{item:3109}}  be "Wardens only". I dont think the current items would be perfect for it, but it would fix the "Lets buff Bork for melee... oh crap all adc's are building it now"

Also it'd be too much like HotS for my taste.  One thing I like about League is the pool of items that allows for a larger breadth of options than something like HotS provides.

Is that a hyperbolic thought process though? How often does anyone except supports want to build {{item:3107}}, so why when making the item for a specific group is it actually a hinderince? 

I never que for a game thinking, I am going to Be the redemption Twitch

Restricting items by class would mean that no champion could do anything outside of its class. There would be no diversity for champions, and Riot would be enforcing a specific meta and playstyle on the game.

What about champions who don't really fit in any category, or champions who have qualities of 2 or 3? What about champions who have lots of build options and playstyles right now, like Sion? Vanguard Sion would be the only option for him. No more Juggernaut Sion, or AD Sion, or AP Sion, or Enchanter Sion, or Warden Support Sion, etc.

Riot does not, and will not, make items role-specific or even champion-specific because it ruins diversity and restricts innovation and experimentation by players.

I think that is the main problem with this game. For some reason they do what is traditional in like 90% of other games. Where Ranged players are Naturally Weaker then Melee, because they have ranged. Ranged champions should be weaker because they can still farm/poke from  a safer distance, while Range champions should be stronger, because they have the risk of getting in close. Even Call of Duty and other FPS have this type of logic with Guns taking multiple bullets to full clips while a Knife is a OHKO.

Thing is, if {{item:3107}} is not at least relatively "enchanter only" without saying it, then either the item needs to fit the class better, or the class needs some viable stats to actually *have something to build towards*. The idea behind it is to give a support a huge zone to simply flip the teamfight in your favor, a major support boon. However, with all the intricacies of that active, it works much better on an initiator who doesn't have to predict where the fight will be, he just goes there, and on someone who can hold a fight to a particular spot.

Overall, {{item:3107}} needs to be redesigned to be more immediately effective so as to make it easier to land without initiating, and maybe some more. It's good on Enchanters, but feels so much better on Wardens and Vanguards. No need to make {{item:3153}} ADC only, just make the effect for the desired class, and if it's practical for them, they will buy it. If someone else is, chop where necessary. Specifically, attack speed tends to be more wasted on melee champs; the ones viable with {{item:3153}} usually hit a set amount of times before they're CC'd out of contention, or their AS is offset by the amount they're forced to run to catch up.

More innovation is worth the risk of item abuse.

Just look at the rest of the genre.

Dota has very high variety in its itemization; the phrase "Anything can work" is a HUGE meme in that community, but its fucking TRUE. Hell, you can pick Sniper (Caitlyn equivalent) and build him such that he fills the role of a single target burst mage. Such huge amounts of room for innovation are what make that game great.

League has less room for innovation, largely because the champions are more locked into specific roles and the items are simpler. RIot has been lowering the number of off builds, but there's still plenty of room for fresh ideas. Proxy Tryndamere with Dark Seal going 2/12 and still being a threat. Support Kayle top with Yi jungle running it down top nonstop from 10 minutes in. Mid Bard going a heal amp build and surprising the enemy team by healing his Fiora for 2k health with three shrines in a bush. Support MF. Mordekaiser deathball-hyperpush strats. Taric and Heimerdinger bot. Finding new shit to do makes this game fun.

The restrictions on Smite's itemization are a huge problem with the game. The way the game actively discourages innovation just takes a huge amount of depth out of the game.

I'm wondering what exactly you are proposing, because if you are proposing locking items for classes, it would ruin a lot of what's fun about this game to people.

Jungle Karthus is fun. Taric top lane is fun. Anivia support is fun. I saw Ahri adc work on ARAM the other day. 

If Riot starts locking items, I'm afraid this game would lose a lot of charm for me. There's something interesting about the theorycrafting of the game; there's something engaging about watching the patch notes and seeing what solutions they come up with for these problems. 

If Riot takes that away, this game loses what makes it interesting. I know, and agree, that the balance is often frustrating, but it's also what keeps me coming back. This game is built on that idea, and I think it's working more often than not. Is it perfect? No. No it isn't. 

However, that doesn't mean that we have to swing to the other extreme. Locking items into certain classes is a pretty extreme solution to what is ultimately a somewhat fun problem, imo. 

They aren't really obsessed with classifications. They are trying to categorize the champions in a way that allows them to think about these problems differently, and there isn't a reason to hate on that, imo. It's a step forward; I love what they've done with mana scaling on enchanters, and I think they are starting to figure out a way to make tank supports more engaging, too. It's not an immediate process, and that's probably a good thing for the longevity of the game. The constant meta shifts keep things fresh, and I'd rather have that than a stale game with a set meta that never changed.

But locking items like {{item:3071}} to melee only, kinda like they made {{item:3085}} ranged only, would just make sense and stop prblems like lethality. Lethality got nerfed bc adcs were abusing the HELL out of it bc riot didn't make it melee only.

I don't agree with Black Cleaver being melee only, mainly because it's been available to champs who use it well (not abuse it) like Miss Fortune for a long time.

Lethality being melee only, on the other hand, would certainly be interesting... I could get behind that. They'd certainly have to take a look at Jhin and Miss Fortune (and Quinn), but I think that could work.
